column1: what a start! Dropped in short, Khawaja is on it in a flash and pulls handsomely over square leg
short of a length outside off, on his toes and drives to backward point
fuller, outside off, driven to mid-off
short again and dispatched! Khawaja pulls for the second time in the over. Poor start from Stanlake
better length, fuller at off stump, defended square to the off side
back of a length on middle and leg, worked off the pads to square leg
full and straight, forced through midwicket with a straight bat
full outside off, a booming swing and a miss from Hales
a very sweet straight drive, but it's too straight as it cannons into the non-striker's stumps...the 12th man
nearly drags on! Playing square to a reasonably full delivery, takes the bottom edge into his pad
back of a length at off stump, punched firmly to mid-off, Siddle fumbles and that could have been a tight run
uses his feet and then drives through the covers but there's a sweeper back
goes for the scoop! Walks across outside off, doesn't make contact as he aims over fine leg
and this time he backs away to leg, misses a square drive
full on the pads, clipped to deep square leg
back of a length at middle and off, played to the off side
short of a length, goes for a cross-batted swat and gets hit a painful blow on the top of the back leg
full and straight, driven firmly into the pitch and back to Siddle above his head. A very fine over
goes downtown! Full at off stump, Khawaja clears his front leg and launches it over mid-on
banged in short, slower ball at 117kph, pulled from outside off into square leg
length ball, angled into the pads, got away with this as Hales misses his swing and is taken on the pad
dragged on! Back of a length outside off, he goes for the pull, gets a bottom edge into the stumps. Not really short enough for the shot
scampered run to mid-on! Knocks a length ball to the on side and sprints off. Ferguson pulled out the dive, but the throw was wide
full at off stump, he drives but can't find a gap as mid-off gets across
short outside off, he leans back and flays it square through the off side...poor delivery
edged, doesn't carry! Length ball at off stump, Hales looking to force through the off side. Just in front of Carey
big over the leg side! Hales unleashes his levers, back of a length, swings it over backward square leg
pushed miles down the leg side
that's huge! Miles back into the crowd over deep midwicket...a mighty swing through a length delivery. He's up and running
backs away outside leg and squares to point
beats the outside edge as he stays leg side of the delivery
full at middle and off, pushed to the leg side
chips short of mid-on! He used his feet then whipped it with bottom hand
full at middle and leg, can't get it past mid-on
given lbw! Not sure about that. Ferguson going for the pull, the ball strikes him on the back leg. Height an issue? Were there two noises? Replay shows it's going over
good length at off stump, pushed square into the off side
wide of midwicket! Almost a third down. Hales flicked this strong to the on side, midwicket dived full length but it gets through
full outside off, drives to deep cover
short and wide outside off, Hales can't reach it and gets the wide call
driven in the air, over backward point and wide of third man. Enough width to throw his hands and it
good delivery, tight on middle and off, defended
ouch! A cry of pain from Hales as he misses another pull. Think that's in the stomach, might have taken the top of the hip
short outside off, square drives to deep cover
full outside off, Ross goes for a booming drive and doesn't connect
back of a length outside off, opens to the face to third man
full at off stump, tapped square to the covers
very sweet strike! Dropped in short, Hales swivels on the pull and sends it well back over deep square
and now power through the off side, and even a hand on it at cover can't stop the boundary, a strong drive as Stanlake goes from short to full
full and straight, chipped in the air to long-on
full at off stump, pushed to the covers
pushes a full delivery to the off side
a low full toss at off stump, dragged to long-on
good length at off stump, opens the face and finds backward point
short outside off, a slower ball into the pitch, flapped to deep cover
short on off stump, beats the top edge as Ross tries to upper cut
swings a full delivery from outside off to long-on
moves outside leg and square drives to deep point
fuller at the stumps, a googly, pushed to long-on
plays back and tucks to the on side, Rashid gets across
reaches forward and sweeps from outside off to long-on
fraction short, crunched to deep midwicket
another googly, too short, pulled but straight to deep square...tidy start from Rashid
144kph, good length, fourth stump, he opens the face and runs it to third man
short ball, he rocks back and pulls powerfully over midwicket! Another 50 for Hales. What a tournament he's having!
short and wide, he's back and smashing a cut shot past cover! That was pure power
short and wide again, Hales clubs it through cover again! This was along the deck!
143kph, attempted wide yorker but it's way too wide!
142kph, good length wide of off, he flashes and misses
139kph, full and wide, he slices this high off a thick edge wide of third man who gets around to cover it

leading edge caught at point! Hales yelled 'oh no!'. It was a full leg break wide of off, Hales maybe thought it was a wrong un, he tried to drive to long on, closed the face, it flew off the leading edge to backward point and it's an easy catch
100kph, pushed through outside off, beats him
leg break, nice shape, he drives to cover
shorter wrong un, he's back and working it off the pads through square leg
attempted reverse sweep, Short at slip dives and saves it
quicker leg break outside off, he's back and defending
144kph, back of a length outside off, he's back and guiding this to third man
146kph, back of a length wide of off, he mistimes a cut to backward point
149kph, good length wide of off, he's back and running this to third man
length ball picked up and deposited over deep square! It went 20 rows back. Length on middle, he just used the bottom hand to flick it over the fence
122kph, slower ball, he's back and punching this to deep point
145kph, back of a length on off, he's back and running this to third man

holes out to deep midwicket! Ross wanted to target Head first ball, it was a step hit in his arc, he tried to launch over deep midwicket but got under it and skied it high into the deep, Wells camps under it and takes a good catch
darted into leg, he's back and working this to deep midwicket
darted outside leg, he is back and tucking this behind square
shorter outside off, he's back and punching this to long on
swept up and over backward square! This was a good length to pick up and lift fine behind square with a slog sweep and he does it well
angled into middle, he pushes this to the gap at midwicket and they run well for a couple
full and wide, he drives nicely just past cover, it wasn't timed purely but they get two
angled into leg, he tucks this behind square
slower ball on off, he works this with the angle behind square
bouncer wide of off, he tries to uppercut but misses
127kph, low full toss outside off, he heaves it away through midwicket to the sweeper
128kph cutter on off, he chips this in the air into the gap wide of midwicket
shorter wrong un, he's back and pulling to deep square
tossed up on off, he sweeps firmly through square leg but Wells keeps it to one
leg break outside off, he cuts to backward point
very full yorker length, it squeezed under the bat and misses off
tossed up leg break, 97kph, he drives to long on
clubbed over cover! What a shot! It was a wrong un outside off, he backed away and picked it, and lofted this flat and hard over the fence at cover! Incredible strike
slower ball outside off, 114kph, good length, beats him
shorter slower ball outside off, he cuts to deep point

Nair run out backing up! This is ridiculously unlucky! Morris' straight drive was going for four! He hammered it back at Siddle, it clipped Siddle's heel and smashed into the stumps. Nair had no hope of getting back in time after backing up. He just walked off. He knew it clipped Siddle's foot. It barely brushed it on it's way to the stumps
slower ball outside off, he stands up and punches this to long off
full on off, he pushes this to midwicket for one
low full toss, he's deep in the crease, working this through midwicket
dipping leg break, he reaches it on the full and drives to long on
leg break, he doesn't pick it, drives and gets a thick edge to short third man
wrong un outside off, he sweeps hard, gets a bottom edge that runs behind square
pushed through on middle, he's back and pushing this to long on
an lbw appeal, given not out. He was trying to pull a length ball but it was sliding down
launched straight of long on! This was a slog and hope but he got all of it! Tossed up, in the hitting arc, he swung hard and middled it
135kph, good length wide of off, it's tight to the guideline and the umpire gives it. That might have been unlucky
143kph, full and wide of off, he tries to square drive but misses

caught behind! Plan was obvious. Everything was going to be wide. Morris never adjusted. He stayed leg side trying to loft over cover, it was too far from him, got a thin edge through to Carey and it's an easy catch
attempted yorker, 143kph, he gets it on the full and pushes to long on
140kph, good length wide of off, he swings hard and misses
he tries to step across and paddle scoop a 141kph wide yorker and it goes through his legs
wide yorker, 146kph, perfectly bowled, he misses
wide yorker, 134kph, he square drives to deep point
141kph in the slot, he tries to heave over midwicket but miscues, it rolls to the gap at deep square
Bowled him! Brilliant yorker. Fractionally slower at 132kph, it dipped a touch and was right on the money, got under Sams' bat as he tried to go over midwicket and the stumps lit it

scoops over short fine! Full and straight, he stepped inside it and scooped it over short fine, long chase for Short who slides and saves initially, it rolls along the rope and then Agar comes in to knock it back. They have saved a run
134kph, full and way wide, nearly off the cut strip

full outside off, he drives to long on and they push for two. Salt throws to the non-striker's and Tremain dives. The umpire sends it upstairs. The bat did bounce but it was grounded over the line initially
yorker outside off, he heaves this away through midwicket for a couple
short of a length outside off, cracks this strongly square of the wicket but there's a deep point in place
full at off stump, driven to mid-off
short of a length, straight, shoveled to deep square
good work at backward point to cut off a square drive
crunched wide of mid-on! Short of a length, Salt pulls strongly and it beats Ross as he runs across and nearly loses his trousers

well taken at mid-on! That's big. Very well bowled, a slower ball, Salt went to turn it into the on side and just ended up chipping to the right of mid-on. Alex Hales made good ground to hold a vital catch
full at the stumps, driven to cover
worked with bottom hand down to long-on and he can't stop the second from the long boundary
leans back and drives to cover
stretches forward and plays to the off side
flicked off the pads through straight midwicket, nicely placement
back of a length, hit into the pitch and it goes wide of Cook to long-on
round the wicket, pushed into the pads, flicked to deep square
skids under the bat as he goes for the cut
comes forward and drives firmly to the cover ring
whipped off the pads through midwicket
down the pitch, short of mid-on! Doesn't get near it, drags the shot down the ground. Lack of timing saved him
deep in the crease, flicks deep into the leg side
nearly drags on, but gets the boundary! Length ball outside off, Weatherald aims square and it takes a bottom edge past off stump and beats the keeper
short of a length, worked off the pads
too straight, Head is neatly inside the line and flicks it off his hip fine of short fine leg
fuller on off stump, 131kph, tapped backward of point
over short third man! He goes after some width, more top edge than middle as he drives but he gets enough on it
short of a length, pulled strongly to deep square
flicked from outside off to mid-on
full outside off, angled to backward point
flayed! Full outside off, he leans back a little as he drives but thumps this through the covers
big top edge, taken at cover! Silence around the ground. Weatherald goes for the pull against a shorter delivery, extra pace, goes straight up off a top edge and Ferguson just about settles under it
full at the stumps, pushed to mid-off
good length at middle and off, defended. Excellent over.
worked off the pads to deep square
driven to backward point
tight on middle and leg, tapped into the covers
oh dear, that's not good...Head square drives and Sams just lets it through his hands at point. Well, he was done by a bit of spin
worked down to long-on
full at middle and off, threaded through the off side with a powerful drive between cover and mid-off
shorter outside off, he misses his cut and isn't impressed with himself
back of a length at middle and leg, defended into the pitch and it bounces over the stumps...gets called through for quick single
round the wicket, full outside off, pushed to cover
very full outside off, jabbed to cover
back of a length, angled in from round the wicket, played to backward point. Good comeback from the first-ball boundary
pulled off the pads behind square
fuller outside leg, swept strongly backward of square
wider outside off, brings out the reverse sweep and gets it wide of short third man...superb batting
beaten this time as this one skids on outside off, goes under the bat
full on the pads, tucked into midwicket
uses his feet and whips wide of long-on for a brace...handy over
round the wicket, full at off stump, driven firmly into the pitch and bounces to cover
angled into the pads, closes the face and works into midwicket
over the wicket, on the pads, whipped to deep square
round the wicket, short outside off, angled to third man
powered down the ground! Came back over the wicket, in the slot outside off, drives through the line straight of mid-off
on the pads this time, gets a bit lucky as the well-timed clip goes straight to deep square
dragged on! Alex Ross was just talking about getting these left handers cutting. Back of a length, Head aims to play square and drags into his stumps
length ball outside off, square drives to deep point for a couple to get underway
good length at off stump, defended
works a straight ball to midwicket
comes forward and defends to the bowler
full outside off, drives into the covers
133kph, cutter, back of a length, he cuts through point
short and wide, he's back and cutting to deep point

slower ball, wide, he square drives past point, Cook fumbles on the rope, they get two and then Carey comes back for three and has to dive. They check upstairs for the boundary, it's just three, and the run out, but he made it easily
angled into leg, he defends this to the gap at midwicket
back of a length slower ball, he's back and tucking this behind square
slower ball offspinner, angled down leg, he glances fine for a single
sparyed way down leg and Lenton can't take it cleanly! Five wides. Lenton got an awkward bounce
137kph, fuller on off, he drives neatly to mid off
angled into leg, he clips this through forward square leg
126kph, full and wide, he slices a square drive to deep point
good length on middle, he pushes a drive straight of mid on
wide low full toss, he square drives to deep point
full on leg stump, he clips this through midwicket
slower ball wide of off, he tries to square drive but misses
cracking cover drive! Fractionally over pitched and he crunches thin through cover and beats deep point with incredible timing
136kph, angled into off, he mistimes a drive to mid on
short ball, he pulls not in total control but it lands short of the fielder
slower ball on middle, he defends to cover-point
139kph, short and wide, he is back and placing a good cut shot into the gap at backward point! Bad ball and punished by the man in form
131kph, shorter length on middle, cramping him, he tucks it off the back foot to midwicket
slower ball on middle, he's back and turning this forward of square
bouncer but way too high and a wide
slower ball outside off, he mistimes a drive to cover
short slower ball, he's back and pulling through forward square
low full toss, he defends to mid off and pinches a single
131kph, full on off, he pushes to mid off and they pinch a tight one
137kph, full half volley, he drives powerfully along the ground straight of long on for two
back of a length, fourth stump line, he cuts through backward point to the sweeper
short ball, he swivels and smokes a pull shot behind square! He was so quick to thump that to the gap
short slower ball, he thumps this pull forward of square! He spotted the slower ball, waited and smacked it infront of square after the man had been moved finer
short and wide, he cuts firmly to deep point

Ferguson runs out Carey with a direct hit! Carey took a huge risk and has cooked himself. He mishit this towards mid off, but Ferguson was in tight at cover, comes across and it bounces up perfectly for him, he underarms at the non-striker's and Carey is short despite his best dive
leg break on off, he's back and defending

holes out to deep square! Rashid tried to go straight away. He took on the slog sweep but it was a leg break that bounced a touch, he gets a top edge high to deep forward square and Green on as the substitute takes the catch 10m from the rope
drifting down leg, it comes off pad and isn't called wide
pushed through on off, he's back and working this to midwicket
tossed up on off, he drives back to the bowler
pushed through on off, he defends
slower ball on off, he's back and working this to square leg
fuller on off, he's working this off the front foot to midwicket

lbw! Good length skidding through straight, he's pinned on the crease, hit above the knee roll deep in the crease and it's given! Height the only issue like Ferguson's earlier. Otherwise it looked very good
beaten by a 140kph, length ball climbing outside off
back of a length, he pushes to point and they take a tight one
good length wide of off, he leaves and it's not called. It was well inside the guideline
short and way wide of off and the crowd roar as the umpire's arms stretch out!
an edge short of Lenton! It was wide and he tried to cut, got it off the toe and it lands just short of the keeper diving forward
he steps outside off, Tremain fires it wide outside the return crease and it's called
another wide! Again Neser was moving across and he pushed it too wide. It's nearly off the cut strip
cracked through cover! A length ball wide of off, he stands tall and smashes this off the back foot through cover and it races to the rope
135kph, full outside off, he drives hard straight of long on for an easy two
another wide! A fourth in the over! Neser steps outside off again and Tremain again goes for too wide
drilled through forward square! A length ball in the slot, he was set back and he clubs this through forward square and finds the gap!
nearly another wide! Short and wide outside the guideline, Neser didn't move, he reaches out and gets an edge off the toe to short third man
slower ball, he's back and cutting hard to deep point
slower ball, on off, he drives to cover's left but just for a single

top edge and Nair hangs on at short fine! Just! Slower ball, Neser tried to launch over deep square, the top edge went straight to short fine, Nair was under it but never looked confident, it dipped away from him late, he dived and held on!
short slower ball, 116kph, he mistimes a pull to short fine
chipped to mid off! 113kph, slower ball wide of off, he backed away too far and just chipped it off the toe to mid off and it's an easy catch for Hales
full and wide, he drills a drive to deep cover, Tremain does a great job on the rope to save two
slower ball, on off, he pushes this to cover for a single to retain the strike
caught behind! Is that the game?! 135kph, short and wide, pace on, he tried to thrash a cut, it was in his wheelhouse, he just got a thin edge as it bounced a touch and Lenton does the rest!
yorker into leg, he digs it out
141kph, full on leg, he drives to mid on, Doggett makes a good stop to save extra runs
lofted high to deep midwicket and Sams let it go! He and Hales were coming in, Sams should have caught it and he just let it hit the ground!
slower ball wide of off, he swings and misses! The Thunder have done it!
full outside off, he craves this to long off for one
